attributes.action: HMT Lancastria  ( allow the files to be open to the public and relatives now)
attributes.additional_details:
The sinking of the  troopship  HMT Lancastria on the 17th June 1940  evacuating troops and civilians from France was "hushed up"  at the time,   and indeed to this day  it is not as well known as a tragedy as those maritime disasters of  1912 and 1914.

In fact, the loss of life  on the Lancastria was greater than  on the Titanic and the Lusitania combined.

Please  now lift the "100 year rule"   on disclosure of  the file held on the events surrounding the loss of HMT Lancastria.
